intro: Calcitrapa, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, adapted to reduce water loss. Calcitrapa is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
